insights.label: Overview
insights.summary: Traffic is healthy with under 1% error rate and stable latency within acceptable thresholds.
findings: Usage peaks around 15:00–18:00 with more than 900 sessions.
Overnight traffic is low but consistent, which suggests global or batch usage.
No major spikes in errors across the last 24 hours.
recommendations: Keep current capacity settings; no scale-up required.
Monitor upcoming releases for potential impact on p95 latency.
Use this pattern as a baseline for future anomaly detection.

insights.label: Reliability
insights.summary: Error rate is below 1%, with no critical failure windows.
findings: Highest error count is 6 events in the 15:00 window.
Error distribution is proportional to traffic volume.
No single hour shows a sustained spike.
recommendations: Continue to log root causes for all 5xx errors.
Introduce SLOs: 99.5% success rate over rolling 7 days.
Prepare runbooks for incident response even if volume is low.

insights.label: Performance
insights.summary: p95 latency is ~640 ms, acceptable but with room for improvement.
findings: Latency correlates with peak sessions but stays under 800 ms.
No evidence of persistent queuing or timeouts.
Largest spikes align with mid-day batch-type workloads.
recommendations: Cache static metadata where possible to shave off 50–100 ms.
Set early-warning alerts at 900 ms p95 latency.

insights.label: Cost
insights.summary: APIM cost for the last 24 hours is moderate compared to traffic volume.
findings: Blended APIM cost is about $37.45 for 4.8k sessions.
Cost per 1k sessions is within the expected envelope.
No abnormal bursts in call volume.
recommendations: Track trends over 30 days to detect gradual cost creep.
Tag all EVA workloads by app and feature for chargeback.
Introduce cost dashboards for product owners (future EVA LiveOps feature).
